unnormalised: Someone asked me what are some challenges in software development projects in India. Well, bhai, there are many! One big thing is communication - imagine trying to explain a complex algorithm to a client who only understands Hindi using Google Translate! Then there's the whole 'chalta hai' attitude. Like, the code *mostly* works, so it's okay to release it? No, boss! That's how you get bugs that crash the whole system when users hit the server at 10:00 AM. And deadlines? They're more like suggestions, especially if a festival is coming up - no one wants to work during Diwali or Holi!

They're coding in Java 7 when the rest of the world is on Java 17! Getting them up to speed takes time and money. unnormalised: Lastly, documentation. Or, rather, the lack thereof! No one wants to write documentation. The handover notes are usually something like "Code works, good luck! - Rakesh, 14/08/2023". And good luck figuring out what "feature XYZ" actually does. So, yeah, software development in India is a wild ride, but hey, it's never boring!
